title: Calories in a Large Cucumber
meta_description: Discover calories in a large cucumber, plus carbs, fiber, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with quick tweaks for recipes.
assumptions: Fresh, raw, with peel; large size ≈300 g total weight.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by variety, freshness, growing conditions, and exact size; check produce labels or apps for precision.

quick_answer.text: A large cucumber provides about 45 kcal, with high water content and 3 g fiber for hydration and digestion.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Pickled in brine (adds vinegar and salt)

faqs.q: How many calories in a large cucumber?
faqs.a: Approximately 45 kcal for a 300 g large cucumber.
Yes, about 10.8 g carbs total, mostly from natural sugars and fiber.

faqs.q: What's the fiber content in a large cucumber?
faqs.a: Around 3 g of dietary fiber, aiding digestion and satiety.

faqs.q: Do cucumbers have any protein or fat?
faqs.a: Minimal: 2.1 g protein and 0.3 g fat per large cucumber.

faqs.q: How does size affect calories in cucumbers?
faqs.a: Medium (200 g) ≈30 kcal; extra-large (400 g) ≈60 kcal—scale by weight.
